Authors: Condrobimo A.R., Nindito H., Dian Sano A.V., Kosala R., Ranti B., Harso Supangkat S.
Title: Cluster Analysis Application at the Five Largest Airports in Indonesia to Carry Out a Tax-Free Policy
Source title: Proceeding - 2018 International Conference on ICT for Smart Society: Innovation Toward Smart Society and Society 5.0, ICISS 2018
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduated Program-Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science, Institut Teknologi Kreatif Bina Nusantara, Malang, 65126, Indonesia; Faculty of Computer Science, Universitas Indonesia, Depok, 16424, Indonesia; Sekolah Teknik Elektro Dan Informatika, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Condrobimo, A.R., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduated Program-Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nindito, H., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduated Program-Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dian Sano, A.V., Computer Science, Institut Teknologi Kreatif Bina Nusantara, Malang, 65126, Indonesia; Kosala, R., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduated Program-Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ranti, B., Faculty of Computer Science, Universitas Indonesia, Depok, 16424, Indonesia; Harso Supangkat, S., Sekolah Teknik Elektro Dan Informatika, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Bandung, Indonesia
Abstract: The objective of this study is to apply cluster analysis on Indonesia's international tourism data set. Algorithm used in this cluster analysis is k-means and the number of cluster (k) is four and the similarity measurement between members of clusters is based on Euclidean distance. The source of data set was taken from Ministry of Tourism portal of Republic of Indonesia per November 2017. The results of this cluster analysis is presented in a table consisting of four clusters and each cluster consists of its members. Cluster analysis in this study can be used more quickly and efficiently to identify countries which will be the promotional and campaign targets on tax-free incentives for foreign tourists assuming a constraint that promotional and campaign budgets are always limited so that the related policy makers need to set a priority on targeted countries. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Budget control; Cluster analysis; Data mining; Euclidean distance; Indonesia; International tourisms; Number of clusters; Policy makers; Similarity measurements; tax-free; Tourism portal; Economic analysis

Authors: Sano A.V.D., Imanuel T.D., Intanadias Calista M., Nindito H., Condrobimo A.R.
Title: The Application of AGNES Algorithm to Optimize Knowledge Base for Tourism Chatbot
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Computer Science Study Program, Malang, 65126, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sano, A.V.D., Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Computer Science Study Program, Malang, 65126, Indonesia; Imanuel, T.D., Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Computer Science Study Program, Malang, 65126, Indonesia; Intanadias Calista, M., Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Computer Science Study Program, Malang, 65126, Indonesia; Nindito, H., Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Computer Science Study Program, Malang, 65126, Indonesia; Condrobimo, A.R., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Most tourists have limited time and schedule when they are visiting a particular tourism area. One of the main issues faced by those tourists is that they can not make simple queries to search engines about, for example, which sites or places to visit optimally if we only have one day or two-day visit? Search engines are better and better in replying users' queries with relevant answers. However, search engines are not always able to respond queries suited to users' characteristics such as their styles, personalities, knowledge backgrounds, etc. Also, search engines are not as flexible as chatbots in enabling dialogical-communication-queries. This case study aims to respond aformentioned issue by applying hierarchical cluster analysis on a set of tourism sites around Malang city, Malang regency, and Batu city based on AGNES (Agglomerative Nesting) algorithm. The result, then, is fed into chatbot's knowledge base. This chatbot will assist tourists to get information on which possible sites they have to visit optimally if they are under limited vacancy-Time constraints. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Cluster analysis; Hierarchical systems; Information management; Knowledge based systems; Search engines; Chatbot; Chatbots; Hierarchical cluster analysis; Knowledge base; Time constraints; tourism sites; Clustering algorithms

Authors: Fernando E., Surjandy, Ernawaty, Raharto Condrobimo A., Fitria Murad D., Madeleine Tirtamulia L., Savina G., Listyo P.
Title: User Behavior Adopt Utilizing Fin Tech Services on Online Transportation in Indonesia (Scale Validation and Developed Instrument)
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University Information Systems Audit Program, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Online Learning, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia

Abstract: The Aim this study is to explore the views of consumer intentions in using FinTech services in online transport.This study focuses only on the process testing phase of the research instrument to be used at the next stage of the survey phase. Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) is used as the foundation of conceptual model theory and research instrument developed. Models and instruments were then validated by a pilot study method involving 133 communities as respondents who had been declared valid. analysis of survey data obtained through Smart PLS version 3 applications. This analysis is used to ensure the reliability and validity of the instruments that have been developed. The results of this study indicate that the variable Attitude toward use with 3 instruments, Perceived Useful variable with 5 instruments, Perceived Ease of Use variables with 5 instruments, Intention to use variables with 6 instruments that stated reliability with values above 0.5 and validity with values above 0.7.The instrument has been eligible to collect data from the actual survey in this study. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: adoption technoloogy; fintech; online transportation; TAM

Authors: Surjandy, Fernando E., Meyliana, Raharto Condrobimo A., Edbert I.S., Vivien
Title: The safe and trust factors of mobile transportation system for user behavior in Indonesia
Source title: 2018 International Seminar on Research of Information Technology and Intelligent Systems, ISRITI 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Audit Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Surjandy, Information Systems Audit Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fernando, E., Information Systems Audit Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Meyliana, Information Systems Audit Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Raharto Condrobimo, A., Information Systems Audit Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Edbert, I.S., Information Systems Audit Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Vivien, Information Systems Audit Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Mobile transportation recently new phenomenon including in Indonesia country the positive value of mobile transportation system makes the user easy to get the support of delivery things and transportation. However, until now there is the negative impact of usage of mobile transportation system such as deception of mobile transportation account, robbery of the driver or passenger accompanied by murder. Therefore, this research by using the quantitative method with correlation bivariate will find the answer the correlation between safe and trust factors of mobile transportation. Do the passenger trust to the driver of mobile transportation? Do the passenger trust in mobile transportation system? Does the company mobile transportation brand image influence the passenger? Does the passenger feel safe using the mobile transportation system? The research found 37 significant correlation factors from 312 respondents. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Condrobimo A.R., Abbas B.S., Trisetyarso A., Suparta W., Kang C.-H.
Title: Data mining technique with cluster anaysis use K-means algorithm for LQ45 index on Indonesia stock exchange
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Information and Communications Technology, ICOIACT 2018
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information System Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Civil Engineering Department, University of Technology Yogyakarta, Yogyakarta, Indonesia; Department of Electronic and Communication Engineering, Kwangwoon University, South Korea
Authors with affiliations: Condrobimo, A.R., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia, Information System Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Abbas, B.S., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Trisetyarso, A., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suparta, W., Civil Engineering Department, University of Technology Yogyakarta, Yogyakarta, Indonesia; Kang, C.-H., Department of Electronic and Communication Engineering, Kwangwoon University, South Korea
Abstract: This study aims to apply data mining techniques with cluster analysis on stock data registered in LQ45 in Indonesia Stock Exchange. The cluster analysis used in this method is k-means algorithm, the data in this research is taken from Indonesia Stock Exchange. The cluster analysis in this study analyzed the characteristics of data volumes and stock values, while the results in this study were presented in the form of cluster members visually. Therefore, this cluster analysis in this research can be used for quick and efficient identifier for each member of LQ45 index cluster based on share value for each cluster and its volume. The identification results can be used by beginner-level investors that begun to be interested in stock investments to help make informed decisions about stock trading on desired cluster groups. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Rule based classification for diseases articles using oracle database 12c
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017

Authors with affiliations: Nindito, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Condrobimo, A.R., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dian Sano, A.V., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The main problem faced by business companies or institutions today is too much information that is in circulation and cannot be properly processed. On the other hand, the process of sorting out useful documents from existing documents to generate useful information poses both individual and organizational challenges. This paper presents a model on how to classify by loading documents into Oracle database and using rule-based classification for further action. The result can be classified according to the categories defined and formulated before, stored in the database and making it easier for decision makers. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Sibuea G.H.C., Napitupulu T.A., Condrobimo A.R.
Title: An evaluation of information system using HOT-FIT model: A case study of a hospital information system
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information System Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sibuea, G.H.C., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Napitupulu, T.A., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Condrobimo, A.R., Information System Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Kasih Group has used the information system, Hospital Information System (HIS) Kasih Group used for recording and reporting. After 8 years are applied, the author felt the need to do an evaluation of the information systems to identify and measure the success rate of the application/ implementation of the HIS Kasih Group. This study aims to evaluate the system information by using HOT FIT Model. HOT FIT Model has four perspectives namely information systems Human (Human), Organization, Technology and the benefits provided. With all four perspectives is expected to yield an appropriate evaluation to measure the success and influence of HIS implementation. This study will be tested to 213 HIS users by using questionnaires and interviews. The data collection technique is used to assess the effect of each perspective HOT FIT Model. Data will be analyzed quantitatively by using multiple regression. The results showed that 1) the impact on the use of User Satisfaction System, 2) use of the system positively affects user satisfaction. 3) Quality of information is User Satisfaction of positive influence. 4) Quality of Service is positive effect on User Satisfaction. 5) Quality Systems positive effect on Organizational Structure. 6) Quality of Service positive effect on Organizational Structure. 7) Environment Organization positive effect on Organizational Structure. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Evaluation; HIS; HOT FIT Model; Information Systems
Index Keywords: Hospitals; Information management; Information systems; Quality of service; Surveys; Evaluation; Hospital information systems; Hot fits; Multiple regressions; Organizational structures; Quality of information; System information; User satisfaction; Information use

Authors: Nindito H., Sano A.V.D., Condrobimo A.R.
Title: Comparative study of storing unstructured data type between BasicFile and SecureFile in Oracle Database 12c
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Nindito, H., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sano, A.V.D., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Condrobimo, A.R., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The nature of critical business information is changing rapidly and is no longer limited to structured text or numeric data. Unstructured content such as images, audio, video, PDF, Word documents and other types are becoming more and more common in various fields. Database is an area that has found extensive use of images and text in past few years. This paper present a model for storing unstructured data such as document in database using BasicFile and SecureFile method within Oracle 12c Database. The result, SecureFiles method is more efficient in using storage and faster then BasicFiles method. © 2016 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Information management; BasicFiles; Comparative studies; Critical business; Oracle; Oracle database; SecureFiles; Unstructured; Unstructured data; Database systems
